title: Rain warning delays landmark trial of Hong Kong's rebel mogul Jimmy Lai
summary: Lai is accused of colluding with foreign forces under a Beijing-imposed national security law.

title: Israeli minister says Sydney Harbour Bridge protesters ‘useful idiots’ who fell for terrorist propaganda
summary: Sharren Haskel says she is disappointed at ‘people marching with terrorist organisations’ and denies starvation occurring in Gaza Follow our Australia news live blog for latest updates Get our breaking news email , free app or daily news podcast An Israeli government minister has said the thousands of Australians who marched across the Sydney Harbour Bridge to protest the killing in Gaza were “naive” and “useful idiots” for Hamas. Sharren Haskel, Israel’s deputy foreign affairs minister, also said during Friday’s interview on ABC radio that there was not a “real famine” in Gaza. Continue reading...

title: Trump administration claims powers of D.C. police chief
summary: Attorney General Pam Bondi said in a directive issued Thursday evening that DEA boss Terry Cole will assume "powers and duties vested in the District of Columbia Chief of Police."

title: Australia finds record meth, cocaine, heroin use in wastewater analysis
summary: Australians consumed drugs with a street value of about $7.5bn, representing a 34 percent rise in annual consumption.

title: Trump promises to ‘save’ jailed Hong Kong media tycoon Jimmy Lai
summary: Closing arguments are due to begin in the national security trial of Jimmy Lai, 77, a critic of China's Communist Party.
